page.title: 06CARREFOUR HYPERMARKET
page.content: A HYPERMARKET IS A CAREFULLY PLANNED OUT_OF_TOWN SHOPPING CENTRE IN WHICH A WIDE RANGE OF GOODS AND SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE IN A SINGLE COMPLEX. HYPERMARKETS ASSUME A MOBILE AND AFFLUENT POPULATION WITH A HIGH LEVEL OF CAR OWNERSHIP. HYPERMARKETS SEEK TO CHANGE TRADITIONAL SHOPPING PATTERNS BY ATTRACTING CUSTOMERS WHO WILL MAKE A RELATIVELY INFREQUENT VISIT TO PURCHASE IN BULK ITEMS WHICH ARE NORMALLY BOUGHT LOCALLY ON A MORE FREQUENT BASIS. ADVANTAGES OF THE HYPERMARKETS ARE THAT THEY RELIEVE CONGESTION IN CROWDED SUBURBAN DISTRICTS AND SHOPPING IS MADE MORE PLEASANT AND EASY WHERE ALL SERVICES ARE LOCATED AT A SINGLE CENTRE WITH ADJACENT CAR PARKING FACILITIES. EVEN SO THERE ARE HIGH TRANSPORT COSTS INVOLVED AND THE CENTRES CONSUME EXCESSIVE AMOUNTS OF LAND.(SLIDE C)
